title: #GreenShift Photography Competition
text:
In recent years, plastic pollution has emerged as a major challenge in Nepal. The recent discovery of microplastics in Mount Everest sheds a stark reality of this deep-rooted issue. Plastics have entered the forests and rivers and our natural environment impacting biodiversity. Thus, there is a great need to create awareness about this ever-growing issue of plastic pollution. 

Photography serves as a transformative tool, offering unique perspectives through various lenses and enabling diverse narratives to emerge. It holds the remarkable ability to persuade and shed light on pressing issues, compelling viewers to take action in preserving our environment. 

With the launch of the GreenShift campaign, this photography competition sets out to provide a dynamic platform for the youth across Nepal to engage with environmental concerns and celebrate the beauty of our natural world while also highlighting emerging challenges. Targeted specifically towards the youth of Nepal, this competition aims to ignite passion, promote creativity, and drive meaningful change. 

Under the #greenshift campaign, we encourage young and budding photographers aged 15-29 to contribute to this campaign by submitting photography on this issue of plastic pollution by exploring the following realms: 

  • Plastics and environment: Strong visuals depicting how plastics have encroached our natural environment. 
  • Plastics and urban life: Strong visuals that represent how plastic waste have become an integral part of the urban life. 
  • Plastics and humans: Strong visuals that represent how waste workers and general public interact with the plastic around them. 
Visual merit and creativity 
  • Strong visuals 
  • Thoughtful and impactful message behind the photograph 
  • Strong visuals of the nature, environment and the current plastic pollution crisis 
Storytelling and perspective 
  • Clear link to plastic pollution and/or environment 
  • Compelling Strong story behind the photo 
  • Unique perspective on the thought and photo clicked 
Eligibility criteria & Information 
  • Young budding photographers aged 15-29 all over Nepal are invited to submit their photographs adhering to the competition's guidelines 
  • CREASION reserves the right to correspond with selected participants for photograph amendments before announcing a winner, and such amendments may or may not result in that participant winning the competition. 
  • By entering the competition, the participant grants CREASION all rights to their work and confirm that it is their work, and not that of someone else, or copied. 
  • CREASION reserves the right to make amendments to any winning photograph as deemed necessary. 
  • Photographers must be in digital format (.jpeg, .jpg or .png) format in good resolution 
  • Photographs can be taken from any device attainable to the participants 
  • Photographs must be taken within Nepal 
How to Submit 

To submit your creative photographs, the participants can submit their complete application through https://forms.gle/VeS5oMcagvJa6onQ9 by following the steps below: 

  1. Fill up the basic information in the form 
  1. Write a brief narrative on the significance of the image to the themes of the photo 
  1. Where and when the photo was taken 
  1. About You and you motivation behind taking the particular photograph 
  1. Attach your photograph to the form and click submit 
Prizes 

Cash prizes and certificates will be provided to the top 2 photos. 1st prize: NRs. 5,000; 2nd Prize: NRs. 2,500 

In addition, a selection of the shortlisted photographs will be featured in the CREASION’s social media platforms and website and will be provided with certificates. 

Submissions Close: 7th May,2024 

The winners will be announced publicly via social media platforms of CREASION. 

Contact details for further information or any queries: 

Contact: greenshift@creasion.org or +977 – 9802343995
